--- title: "Installation" data: September 2022 --- # First Comparison: R vs RStudio :::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} R is the magic software that lets us do cool things with data. Download [R](https://cran.rstudio.com/bin/windows/base/R-4.2.1-win.exe) ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} RStudio is the interface for how to use R. Download [RStudio](https://download1.rstudio.org/desktop/windows/RStudio-2022.07.2-576.exe) ::: :::::::::::::: # Second Comparison: Base R vs the Tidyverse :::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Base R is native to R; no additional installations are required. If you use this, I will turn in my grave. Please don't make your life more difficult, use the Tidyverse. ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Run this code in the console to download the tidyverse ``` r install.packages("tidyverse") ``` In order to be able to use this package, put this code at the top of your R Script or RMD file ``` r library(tidyverse) ``` ::: ::::::::::::::

Selecting Columns

:::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} ###### Base R `df$column_name` `df[[]]` ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} ###### Tidyverse `df %>% select()` ::: ::::::::::::::

Making New Columns

:::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"}
Base R
`df$profit <- df$revenue - df$cost`
::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"}
Tidyverse
`df %>% mutate(profit = revenue - cost)`
or
`mutate(df, profit = revenue - cost)`
::: ::::::::::::::

Filtering Data

:::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Base R df[df$temperature > 45] ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Tidyverse `df %>% filter(temperature > 45)` or `filter(df, temperature > 45)` ::: :::::::::::::: ## Grouping & Summarising Data :::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Base R I'm not sure how to do this yet... ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Tidyverse df %>% group_by(city) %>% summarise(Avg_House_Price = mean(house_price)) ::: :::::::::::::: ## Sorting Data :::::::::::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Base R `mtcars[order(mpg, -cyl),]` ::: ::: {.column width=\"45%\"} Tidyverse mtcars %>% arrange(mpg, desc(cyl)) or arrange(mtcars, mpg, desc(cyl)) ::: ::::::::::::::
Check out [this page](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/articles/base.html) for more comparisons. Filtering Data in Base R: - https://www.mitchcraver.com/2021/06/15/subsetting-and-filtering-a-data-frame-in-r/ - https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/crunch/vignettes/filters.html
